New Records: Los Angeles Dodgers pitchers tied the postseason record of 33 consecutive scoreless innings.
The Dodgers achieved the largest shutout victory margin in their postseason history.
The Mets experienced their most one-sided postseason shutout defeat.
Key Match Events: Jack Flaherty combined on a three-hitter.
Shohei Ohtani was 2 for 4 with a walk, scoring two runs and driving in another.
Mookie Betts added a three-run double in the eighth inning.
Flaherty allowed two hits over seven innings in the Dodgers' first scoreless postseason start of seven-plus innings since Clayton Kershaw's eight innings in the 2020 NL Wild Card Series.
Max Muncy singled up the middle, scoring Betts and Freddie Freeman.
Ohtani chased Senga with an RBI single in the second inning.
Tommy Edman and Freddie Freeman had RBI singles in the fourth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Flaherty left to a standing ovation from the sellout crowd of 53,503.
The Dodgers rallied from the brink of elimination against San Diego to win the NL Division Series in five games with shutouts in the last two games.
The Dodgers opened their pursuit of a record 25th NL pennant by chasing Senga after 1 1/3 innings.
